page.title: 01Leintwardine and District 1.
page.content: The area is mostly given over to farm land and contains the villages of {Leintwardine}(pop. 750)and Downton.The{River Clun}meets the{River {Teme}just before it gets into Leintwardine. There is a church in Downton called St Giles, and one in Leintwardine called St.Mary Magdalene. The name Leintwardine is of Saxon origin - Lenta's wardine i.e Lenta's enclosure. The village is of interest to archaeologists in that the site is identical with that of the Roman Bravonium. There isn't a railway line going through the area. The A4113 passes from S.W.to N.E. The rocks in the area are full of fossils;remains of sea creatures. Sir Roderick Murchison gave the name Monograptus Leintwardinensis to a fossil found on top of Church Hill.
